## clean R environment 
```{r}
rm(list = ls(all=TRUE))
graphics.off()
shell("cls")
```

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## Text 

This is an example of R Markdown document.  
You can insert an R code chunk  
1. Using the RStudio toolbar (the Insert button)  
2. Keyboard shortcut Ctrl + Alt + I ( Cmd + Option + I on macOS)  
3. End a line with two spaces to start a new paragraph.


# Insert Source R Code Here

```{r}
install.packages("datasets")
install.packages("ggplot2")
install.packages.("MASS")
install.packages.("dplyer")

library(datasets)
library(ggplot2)
library(MASS)
lubrary(dplyr)

```

```{r}
view(iris)
mydata<- iris
head(mydata)
str(mydata)

hist(mydata)
```
